info.title: Autobox Domain API
info.description:
This Swagger document defines the Autobox public API and should be treated as a requirements contract.  Note that all endpoints are secured by default and are served over HTTPS.  See the `autobox-auth` project for documentation on authentication.

Note that standard error responses are not called out for every endpoint.  The following standard error responses are common to *every* endpoint:

|Code|Purpose|
|---|---|
|400|Bad Request (Client Error and deny partner login access)|
|401|Unauthorized (the user needs to authenticate)|
|403|Forbidden (the user does not have access to the resource)|
|405|Wrong HTTP Method was used with the given endpoint|
|500|Internal Server Error|

More standard error codes will be added as they become necessary.

post.description: Authenticates the user and return a token.

schema.description: User's credentials to validate in json format.

username.description: User name into domain. For example, username@domain.com

schema.description: Token generated, it indicates that the user was authenticated.

get.description: This endpoint will log out the user.

put.description: Receives a token that will be validated; if it is valid, returns a new valid refreshen token

schema.description: Refreshen Token, new token with extended expiration time by 1 hour.

post.description: Registers a new user in a temporary account that will be activated after clicking activation account and complete the register

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The user info to be registered

company.description: This is an ID of Company

201.description: The account was created. An email was sent to activate the user account. The returned user info contains the generated activation code .

get.description: Gets temporary user info by activationCode

parameters.name: activationCode
parameters.description: The activationCode of the temporary user that is like unique ID to activate the account.

200.description: The temporary user info and its company

404.description: The activation code was already used

get.description: Gets all active companies
Gets user applications filters status, installed and size

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The optional parameter, it can take the next values "active", "inactive", "comingsoon".

parameters.name: installed
parameters.description: The optional parameter to filter installed applications. it accept true/false

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The optional parameter to get user applications. it has a default value equal to five.

get.description: Gets information of an application using its name

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: application name, it similary to Id

appName.description: the short name of the application

appFullName.description: the full name of the application

appStatus.description: application status, it can has the next values 1=ACTIVE, 2=INACTIVE, 3=COMING_SOON

items.description: a message about the requirements needed to get the application

partnerName.description: the short name of the partner

partnerFullName.description: the full name of the partner

installed.description: if true, user has installed application

temporary-user.description: a temporary user that needs to be validated before the account for the user is created

verificationToken.description: the token generated for this user

description.description: Description of the campaign. Used in F9 campaign properties - General tab.

mode.description: Campaign mode. Used in F9 campaign properties - General tab.

name.description: Name of the campaign. Used in F9 campaign properties - General tab.

profileName.description: Campaign profile name. Applies only to the advanced campaign mode.

autoRecord.description: Whether to record all calls of the campaign. Used in F9 campaign properties - Recording tab.

callWrapup.description: Details for the work time after the call. Used in F9 campaign properties - General tab.

agentNotReady.description: Whether to automatically place agents who reach a call timeout in a Not Ready state.

dispostionName.description: Name of disposition automatically set for the call if the timeout is reached.

enabled.description: Whether to limit the wrap-up time of agents.

reasonCodeName.description: Not Ready reason code for agents who are automatically placed in Not Ready state after reaching the timeout

timeout.description: Time limit for agents in wrap-up mode.

ftpHost.description: Host name of the FTP server. Used in F9 campaign properties - Recording tab.

ftpPassword.description: Password of the FTP server. Used in F9 campaign properties - Recording tab.

ftpUser.description: User name for the FTP server. Used in F9 campaign properties - Recording tab.

recordingNameAsSid.description: For FTP transfer, whether to use the session ID as the recording name. Used in F9 campaign properties - Recording tab.

useFtp.description: Whether to use FTP to transfer recordings. Used in F9 campaign properties - Recording tab.

analyzeLevel.description: Voice detection level for an answering machine. The values range from 0 (fast detection) to 11 (accurate detection). Used in F9 campaign properties - Dial Options tab.

CRMRedialTimeout.description: Minimum time before redialing a contact record after all numbers for the contact record have been dialed or skipped. The default is 10 minutes. Used in F9 campaign properties - Dial Options tab.

dialingByStateRules.description: Whether to configure the campaign to follow state dialing rules created in the VCC. Used in F9 campaign properties - Dial Options tab.

dnisAsAni.description: When transferring calls to third parties, whether to override the default DNIS of the domain by using the contacts phone number (ANI) as the DNIS (caller ID).

enableListDialingRatios.description: Whether to use list dialing ratios, which enable multiple lists to be dialed at specified frequencies. Used in F9 campaign properties - Lists tab.

listDialingMode.description: Describes the list dialing mode. Used in F9 campaign properties - Dial Options tab.

noOutOfNumbersAlert.description: When an outbound campaign runs out of numbers to dial, whether to turn off notification messages to administrators and supervisors that the campaign is no longer dialing because the lists are complete.  Used in F9 campaign properties - General tab.

description.description: Optional description of the strategy. Used in F9 campaign properties - Dial Options tab.

enabled.description: Whether the strategy is active. At least one strategy, named Default, must be active. Used in F9 campaign properties - Dial Options tab.

filter.description: Conditions that apply to a strategy Used in F9 campaign properties - Dial Options tab.

conditionGroupingType.description: Types of filters that you can apply.

conditions.description: List of criteria used by the dialer to filter records.

compareOperator.description: Comparison between the contact field (left value) and the value (right value).

leftValue.description: Contact field or variable to use as filter.

name.description: Required name of the strategy. However, you can modify the name at any time. Used in F9 campaign properties - Dial Options tab.

schedule.description: Dialing pattern for the strategy. Used in F9 campaign properties - Dial Options tab.

redialAfterMins.description: Number of minutes for the dialer to wait before redialing a number.

startFromDay.description: Day of the week to start the strategy.

startAfterTimeMins.description: Start time (HH:MM) for the strategy. The strategy can start as soon as the dialing list is ready. If you leave this field blank, the dialer starts to dial immediately. Used in F9 campaign properties - Dial Options tab.

agentAvailability.description: Types of agent states considered available. Autodial campaigns dial only agents that are available to process calls. If omitted, the list is dialed continuously regardless of agent availability.  Used in F9 campaign properties - Dial Options tab.

agentSkillName.description: Numbers dialed only if agents with the specified skill are available. If empty when dialIfAgentsAvailable=True, agent availability is for any skill. When modifyAutodialCampaign specifies agentSkillName=null, the value remains.  Used in F9 campaign properties - Dial Options tab.

defaultIvrSchedule.description: Schedule of the IVR script that processes call flow. Required for inbound and autodial calls. Used in F9 campaign properties - IVR tab.

dialIfAgentsAvailable.description: Whether to dial numbers only if agents with agentSkillName are available. Used in F9 campaign properties - Dial Options tab.

maxNumOfLines.description: Maximum number of outbound phone lines dedicated to the campaign. Used in F9 campaign properties - General tab.

trainingMode.description: Whether the campaign is in training mode. True, Campaign in training mode. False, Campaign not in training mode.

maxNumOfLines.description: Maximum number of inbound phone lines dedicated to the campaign. Used in F9 campaign properties - General tab.

defaultIvrSchedule.description: Schedule of the IVR script that processes call flow. Required for inbound and autodial calls. Used in F9 campaign properties - IVR tab.

actionOnAnswerMachine.description: action to take when the answering machine is detected.("Dialing Options" tab)

actionArgument.description: name of prompt or IVR script to execute when a campaign-related event occurs. It is ignored when action type is DROP_CALL.

actionType.description: action to take when a specific event occurs.

maxWaitTime.description: maximum waiting time for action on answering machine.

actionOnQueueExpiration.description: action to take when the maximum queue time expires, which occurs when no agent is available to take a call.("Dialing Options" tab)

actionArgument.description: name of prompt or IVR script to execute when a campaign-related event occurs. It is ignored when action type is DROP_CALL.

actionType.description: action to take when a specific event occurs.

maxWaitTime.description: maximum waiting time for action on answering machine.

callAnalysisMode.description: types of attempts when a call is answered.("Dialing Options" tab)

callsAgentRatio.description: for campaigns in the predictive mode, number of phone numbers dialed for an agent ready for a new call.("Dialing Options" tab)

dialNumberOnTimeout.description: for campaigns in the preview mode, setup to true Dial number when preview time expires or false Set agent to Not Ready state.("Dialing Options" tab)

dialingMode.description: describes the list dialing mode.("Dialing Options" tab)

distributionAlgorithm.description: method used by the ACD to transfer calls to agents. Restricted to values

distributionTimeFrame.description: time intervals used by distributionAlgorithm. Restricted to values

limitPreviewTime.description: for campaigns in the preview mode, use as follows  true Dial contact number after maxPreviewTime.  false Allow agents to preview the contact number for an unlimited time.("Dialing Options" tab)

maxDroppedCallsPercentage.description: maximum allowed percentage of dropped calls. Use when monitorDroppedCalls is set to true.("Dialing Options" tab)

maxPreviewTime.description: duration until expiration of the preview time.("Dialing Options" tab)

maxQueueTime.description: maximum time allowed for calls in a queue.

monitorDroppedCalls.description: whether to keep track of the dropped call percentage of the campaign.  true Keep track of the dropped calls for the last 30 days or since the last reset.  false Do not keep track of the dropped calls.("Dialing Options" tab)

previewDialImmediately.description: for outbound campaigns in preview mode, use as follows  true Automatically dial the number without waiting for an action from the agent.  false Do not dial the number automatically.("Dialing Options" tab)

f9-campaign-profile.description: this data type contains the details of a campaign profile.

ANI.description: ANI to send with outbound call.

dialingTimeout.description: time to wait before disconnecting an unanswered call and logging it as No Answer. The default is 17 seconds.

initialCallPriority.description: priority initially assigned to inbound and outbound calls on a scale of 1 to 100. Inbound calls have a default priority of 60. Calls with a higher priority are answered first, regardless of their time in a queue. To force calls from a campaign to be answered before those from other campaigns, increase the priority by 1.

maxCharges.description: applies to inbound and outbound calls. Maximum dollar amount for long distance charges. The campaign stops automatically when this amount is reached. Zero means no limit.

numberOfAttempts.description: for outbound campaigns, number of dialing attempts for phone numbers in a list record, including redials due to disposition settings.

dialingSchedule.description: order and time for dialing the numbers in a record.

dialASAPSortOrder.description: order for dialing numbers in the ASAP queue.

dialASAPTimeout.description: duration before records that are not dialed are removed from the ASAP queue and are treated as normal records.

dialASAPTimeoutPeriod.description: unit that specifies the dial ASAP timeout.

dialingOrder.description: dialing order when contact records have multiple phone numbers.

dialingSchedules.description: time ranges used to call each of the three possible number associated with a campaign.

number.description: which numbers associated with a record to consider.

startTime.description: when, in local time, to start dialing numbers for an outbound campaign.

includeNumbers.description: this array contains the types of numbers (Primary, Alt1, Alt2) associated with a campaign.

type.description: dispostion type and it can have the following values [DoNotDial, RedialNumber, FinalDisp, FinalApplyToCampaigns, AddActiveNumber, AddAndFinalize, AddAllNumbers]

dispostion type and it can take a value of the following values [DoNotDial, RedialNumber, FinalDisp, FinalApplyToCampaigns, AddActiveNumber, AddAndFinalize, AddAllNumbers]. If type is DoNotDial or RedialNumber then they need typeParameters. If type is FinalDisp, FinalApplyToCampaigns, AddAllNumbers or AddAndFinalize does not need typeParameters.
